definition.name: Setup Go environment
definition.description: Setup a Go environment and add it to the PATH
definition.author: GitHub

inputs.name: go-version
inputs.description: The Go version to download (if necessary) and use. Supports semver spec and ranges. Be sure to enclose this option in single quotation marks.

inputs.name: go-version-file
inputs.description: Path to the go.mod or go.work file.

inputs.name: check-latest
inputs.description: Set this option to true if you want the action to always check for the latest available version that satisfies the version spec

inputs.name: token
inputs.description: Used to pull Go distributions from go-versions. Since there's a default, this is typically not supplied by the user. When running this action on github.com, the default value is sufficient. When running on GHES, you can pass a personal access token for github.com if you are experiencing rate limiting.

inputs.name: cache
inputs.description: Used to specify whether caching is needed. Set to true, if you'd like to enable caching.

inputs.name: cache-dependency-path
inputs.description: Used to specify the path to a dependency file - go.sum

inputs.name: architecture
inputs.description: Target architecture for Go to use. Examples: x86, x64. Will use system architecture by default.

outputs.name: go-version
outputs.description: The installed Go version. Useful when given a version range as input.

outputs.name: cache-hit
outputs.description: A boolean value to indicate if a cache was hit
